@ThreadSafe
public class IISManager
extends WebServerManager

manages and monitors IIS and IIS express web servers

Matt Ficken

getWebServerInstance

public WebServerInstance getWebServerInstance(ConsoleManager cm,
                                              AHost host,
                                              ScenarioSet scenario_set,
                                              PhpBuild build,
                                              PhpIni ini,
                                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> env,
                                              java.lang.String docroot,
                                              WebServerInstance assigned,
                                              boolean debugger_attached,
                                              java.lang.Object server_name)
Description copied from class: WebServerManager
gets a running WebServerInstance if given an existing assigned WebServerInstance that hasn't crashed and is running, returns that WebServerInstance for additional use. otherwise, if no WebServerInstance or if it crashed, creates a new WebServerInstance and returns it if the same crashed WebServerInstance is provided to this several times, doesn't create replacement for each, uses the first replacement (to not have crashed).

Overrides:
getWebServerInstance in class WebServerManager
debugger_attached - - if TRUE => returned instance must have a Debugger attached (will create a new instance if needed) if FALSE and if assigned instance has a debugger, will still return that assigned instance (which has a debugger attached)
server_name - null or unique name of server (could be list of test cases)
Returns:
See Also:
WebServerInstance.isDebuggerAttached()

Description copied from class: WebServerManager
some web servers can only have one active instance at any one time

Specified by:
